notes: RCs make their own IDs, must begin with center abbreviation as defined in participant table; need to be globally unique in consortium; may be generated by prepending experiment_sample_id with center abbreviation

description: identifier used in the data file (e.g. VCF header / LIMS ID)
notes:
may be the same as experiment_short_read_id if the file does contain sample identifiers
should be present if downstream file contains a sample_id (e.g. BAM, VCF)
some centers have one id for the sample (tube) and a diff ID for the sample as named in the VCF; experiment_sample_id = ID in the VCF file; analyte_id = ID for the tube/aliquot/whatever
Can be missing if RC receives external data

description: sequenced read length (bp); GREGoR RCs do paired end sequencing, so is the example of 100bp indicates 2x100bp.
notes: Can be missing if RC receives external data; all RCs are doing paired-end reads.
facilitates having exome and GS-SR experiments in the same experiment_details table

description: Which capture kit is used. Can be missing if RC receives external data
name and path of bed file uploaded to workspace
notes: Can be missing if RC receives external data

description: Date of data generation (First sequencing date)
notes: Can be missing if RC receives external data; ISO 8601 date format

description: insert size the protocol targets for DNA fragments
notes: Can be missing if RC receives external data

description: sequencing platform used for the experiment
notes: Can be missing if RC receives external data
